creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
(Now matter what you do
And you think nobody know
There is a mouth in the sky talking to you
There is a ear on the wall hearing you)
;the last half is something about stealing, letters are illegible
{Nani shi ki wo
Hito wa shiranu to
Omoe do mo
Ten ni kuchi ari
Kabe ni mimi ari
Nusumi wo suru hito to te
???}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Moral Lessons for Children (Shingaku osana e-toki)
title: No Matter What You Do Someone Will Hear and Talk
